content.rendered:
Leonardo Pierre

Leonardo Pierre is a passionate professional with a strong commitment to making a difference in both the legal and business worlds. Born and raised in the vibrant culture of Haiti, after graduating from high school in Port-au-Prince, Mr. Pierre embarked on a transformative personal and professional journey that brought him to New York. This transition has not only broadened Leonardo’s horizons but also equipped Mr. Pierre with a heightened ability to understand different cultures. In large part, many of Leonardo’s life and professional experiences in Haiti and the United States have provided Mr. Pierre with the ability to bridge communication gaps and connect with diverse audiences.

Leonardo’s professional journey began as an Assistant, and Translator, at Camkids Pediatrics, located in Cambria Heights, Queens. It was in this role that Mr. Pierre began working with legal documents, and discovering his profound passion for law and its dynamic intersection with business. This passion led him to The Espinosa Kearney Law Group, a prestigious firm where he began working as a Paralegal. Leonardo has transitioned into the Marketing Clerk, which permits Mr. Pierre the capacity to merge legal concepts and marketing to ensure the firm’s growth and success. Leonardo is currently is working on a degree in Business-Legal with a concentration for law, as Mr. Pierre aspires to attend law school, and become an attorney.

Leonardo is deeply passionate about volunteering. Mr. Pierre is fluent in four (4) languages including, English, Spanish, French, and Haitian Creole. Mr. Pierre’s unwavering dedication as a paralegal at EKG is fueled by a desire to assist clients in being successful in their matters.
